item.title: Introduction to Science Studies Notes
item.description: The 16 readings here were the required ones featured on the exam. Merton, Robert K. 1942. “The Normative Structure of Science,” pp. 267-278 Early text in science studies — analyzing science as an institution, trying to identify norms. Merton is an institutionalist (institutions in the sense of trust and behavior) — so studied science as a collection of internal rules and scripts (“norms”) Matthew effect Norms can be studied by sociologist There are four main norms that constitute science: universalism, communism, disinterestedness, organized skepticism.
